column4: Hi guys. I'm having issues booting 10.04.3 from USB key. It tells me "Unknown keyword in configuration file: gfxboot"
I've booted it from USB key.
I have also tried re-burning the iso onto the USB, still same issue.
I also can't find other 10.04 version than 10.04.3
Any hints how can I boot the 10.04.3 installer?
be sure to check the md5sum
I'll do that, thank you
it is always better/easer to burn Linux distro ISO in Linux
I did that..
md5sum is correct :<
are you burning slow....
What do you mean :)?
are you using a Linux distro to burn it?
the main thing i would like to get is the temp...
Ok, let's start from scratch. I'm running 11.04 - I used "Startup Disk Creator" (from *UBuntu*) to burn 10.04.3 iso onto my USB. I use ubuntu for 12+ years now :)
if you are using a linux distro get K3B
I've used this tool to 'burn' tens of ubuntu isos on usb sticks
I'm not burning a CD..
ok then you will want unetbootin
that's a KDE tool isn't it, Brasero runs under gnome (just by the way :) )
kk thx!
yes it is a kde tool but will run under gnome and xfce
with 300MB+ of KDE dependencies ;D
i have both kde and gnome so i already have them :)
hah ;) good for you :)!
hope it works out... :) ... i understand why.... i made the move back from 11.4 myself
I'm quite happy with 11.04, I need 10.04 LTS for my aunts shop :)
I do get occasional X crashes, though.
i just could not get used to Unity
I'm running UBuntu Classic on 11.04 (you knew you could do that, right?)
waiting to see how Gnome 3 looks once stable
yeah, that might be interesting
yes but studio had a ton of problems with 11.4
ah, that I didn't know
over 90% of what i do is media on here... and with the move to windows 7 (fail!) i decided to come back to linux... :) so i love studio for the media
ah! great to hear :) I now use Windows 7 like.. twice a year ;)
All right, I don't think it's in lspci. lemme see..
i have all my temps other than the video
i built this computer for windows 7 lol... 7 just is not stable enough for me
:D
GirlyGirl: Sidewinder1: Hah! For the first time 'Startup Disk Creator' failed to do the job. unetbootin did the trick, sweet!
glad it worked out )
any time :)
nope not it
what i'm looking for is temps on my video card... with the grep commands i should be able to put that into my conky...
ah! sweet. let me install lscpi
thank you
What info do you want to extract exactly?
oh, temperatures?
lspci will show my radeon 5670 and i can get the temp with aticonfig --adapter=0 --od-gettemperature
oh, you can? so.. what are we looking for exactly then :)? that's on another computer? (nvidia / ati ?)
Is your graphic card Nvidia or ATI? (If ATI, I believe you already have a solution?)
it is ati... i can see my temps in terminal... but if i can find the grep command i can use that to write to conky
oh! paste that output of that command to paste.ubuntu.com , I'll help you.
are you teasing me?
Come on, I want some grep fun :) Gimme that command output :)
No, not really. I guess I'm trying to understand your question.
If the output of aticonfig --adapter=0 --od-gettemperature is the temperature, what do you need to grep?
grep finds info. If you have the temperature, there's nothing to find. Does that command return the temperature? Sorry, I don't use conky, so I'm not sure why you need grep (which is a 'find' tool)
in conky i can not use the aticonfig.... but if i can get the same info with grep i can use that in conky
do you need administrator privileges to run aticonfig?
no
the command i need to use in conky will look something like this ..... Cpu Temp ${alignr}${execi 5 sensors | grep "temp2" | cut -d "+" -f2 | cut -c1-2}C
Since aticonfig is just any command like grep, why can't you use aticonfig in conky :<? /me is completely lost
right
well i guess if i could figure out the way to lay out the aticonfig command to get conky to read it right i could but i dont... i know the grep...
I'm guessing that execi executres the following command every 5 seconds
i'll give it a try :)
if so, replace sensors | grep "temp2" | cut -d "+" -f2 | cut -c1-2 with your ati command
yes
thank you
you're welcome. lemme know if it worked :)
nope... every thing looks right but no numbers ... so i will keep messing with the code and see what i can come up with... thank you for getting me on the right path
thank you :)
your encouraging bad behavior lol
I only said it was compliment ;) I didn't say it was good behaviour ^_^
lol
got it... ${color}GPU Temp:${color} ${execi 60 aticonfig --adapter=0 --od-gettemperature}Â°C
hah! so it was it :) awesome
I've installed ubuntu, and.. well, the graphics are totally broken meh. I'll start googling.
what gpu
I've no idea. It's ASUS K52J, lemme check.
NVIDIA GeForce 310M (1GB)
wols_ is the nvidia man... :)
got it ;)
you said that was a dual boot you are working on right?
which do you mean? I've installed 10.04.3 on the second laptop. I have 11.04 + win7 on this laptop.
I work on Ubuntu 100%
just a heads up on win 7 sp1 is 900mb and will not install if you have linux dual boot
I don't know what to say.. I think it makes me laugh. Thank you :) (I use win7 for two things = college stuff and GTAIV maybe one a year, nothing else ;))
That's really sad..
just thought i would give you a heads up... when you try to install the sp1 update it will tell you that an unrecognized partition is on the disk and you need to remove it before sp1 can install
Ehhh... :<
It just makes me sad in general, the windows-only policy etc. I simply won't update, but it's certainly an issue for people who dual boot on regular basis.
